sub_title: Director/consultant bij Consultants for Development Programmes (CDP)
summary:
I graduated at Wageningen University (MSc) in tropical agriculture and development economics. I have got over 25 years of experience in implementation and management of rural development and local governance projects. Worked on long-term assignments for international NGOs as well as for the Netherlands bilateral aid agency (DGIS), mostly in East Africa. Since joining CDP as managing director, in January 2003, i've been implementing formulation, review and evaluation missions, most of them as team leader. I have demonstrated sharp analytical skills, resulting in concise, but precise, reporting.

I've got hands-on experience in participatory planning, monitoring and evaluation. Have been team leader for evaluations of complex development programmes for various agencies. Fully conversant with participatory methodologies and logical framework analysis.

I've got good knowledge of regional situations and developments. Lived and worked in Africa for 15 years, of which nine years in Tanzania and five years in Mozambique. I have excellent working knowledge of English, Portuguese and Swahili.
